Hi @rajinisivaram about 

> Looks like we are allowing some clients using the static jaas config and other clients using different dynamic jaas config properties to co-exist in the same JVM. Perhaps that should be tested too? Just changing either producer/consumer in one of the tests to use the static config should be sufficient.

I ended up by having the JaasTestSetup statically set the JAAS config for client2
and so the test `testTwoConsumersWithDifferentSASLCredentials` uses the static JAAS config for consumer2 and everything else uses the dynamic config
@rajinisivaram @ijuma I'm really keen to have this merged before the feature freeze please could you take a 2nd look, thanks
LGTM

I'm not sure happened with Jenkins... I saw ":core:test FAILED" and "Process 'Gradle Test Executor 3' finished with non-zero exit value 1" but there were no failed tests.  :core:test should be unaffected by this patch, which doesn't change the core directory anyway...

Fix AuthorizerIntegrationTest, FetchRequestTest, SaslApiVersionsRequestTest, PlaintextConsumerTest.

Fixed a bug where Fetcher#beginningOffsets and Fetcher#endOffsets incorrectly required a broker with the new ListOffsetsRequest RPC.  Will add this to CompatibilityTest.

@guozhangwang @dguy @enothereska @miguno

There was a somewhat similar discussion on the associated JIRA ticket, and I think someone marked this as relevant for the Kafka 11 release. 

So I'm happy to start an email thread if needed, but I'm a little uncertain whether the non-email discussions regarding this should happen here on github or over on JIRA?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/512/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@ijuma Thanks for the comments. Refined the code as per your suggestions. Now all the unit test cases should pass. Since we already have about 7 unit test cases (such as FileRecordsTest.testRead), do you think we still need to add new test cases for this method? Thanks again.

@shikhar The idea for the fix seems sound, but should we update `VerifiableSourceTask` to implement `commitRecord` and check for properly acked messages? My concern is that just seeing a message generated by the task isn't actually enough to be sure the topic has been created. (In practice, I'm pretty sure we'd not see an issue with this, but as we're closing a few correctness gaps in system tests that came back to bite us, it seems better to get a fix that properly guarantees correctness.) VerifiableProducer logs ack info to do validation like this, but VerifiableSourceTask currently doesn't...

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/511/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

@mjsax In principle, seems like a fair change. A couple of thoughts:

1. Is there a significant benefit to this? It seems the copyrights that it standardized mostly just had slight variants that aren't all that significant -- mostly just longer line widths. These changes admittedly don't affect git history in any significant way since they are just copyrights, but it's still a huge change (tied with some actual code changes as described in the next item).
2. We have quite a few unrelated changes in imports in the patch. Normally I wouldn't worry about these since IDEs do this automatically and the scope is usually pretty limited, but this touches a *lot* of files. I think it's fine to change it, I'm primarily worried about how this will end up impacting a bunch of other in-flight PRs.
3. If we merge this, maybe we should give folks a heads up on the -dev list? IDE settings are probably how we got the 3 or 4 different variants of the header already.
